pull_request.title: Revamp Radio Component with A11Y
pull_request.body: ## Description We are revamping the `Radio` component. Radio components only make sense to be used with two or more. That's the nature of Radios; you need two or more options. The current implementation lets you choose only one Radio button. In this new implementation, you must pass an array of options (similar to other components). This will provide more clarity and avoid forms with one radio button, and this new implementation is accessible. **BREAKING CHANGE**: The new implementation of the `` will break current usage. Once you upgrade this component, you need to change the implementation. Follow the Storybook story to understand the new API. ## Checklist - [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage - [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated ## Steps to Test 1. Pull down PR. 2. `npm run dev`. 3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/form-radio--default 4. Test the functionality. Make sure you can click/select using the mouse or keyboard the toggle and the label

pull_request.title: Improve Tabs, Textarea and Input components along with their Stories
pull_request.body:
## Description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3402/201184091-cf90be61-df40-4035-8331-737435aaedd6.png)


- Fixed the rendered `title` attribute as `aria-label` on the Tablist component
- Added a link and a button as the tabs example so we can ensure focusable elements gets focus when tabbing from the Tab title;
- Moved old form components like Input, Textarea, Label, Radio, and Checkbox to be used from the new `Form.Component` format. The old way still works.
- Added stories to Textarea, Checkbox, Radio
- Improved all Stories in general
- Moved Deprecated components to the end of the list of components
- Changed storybook configuration to list the stories alphabetically 
- Added `Validation` support to Input and Textarea

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [x] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test — Tabs

1. Pull down PR.
2. `npm run dev`.
3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/newtabs--default
4. Check the component renders with an `aria-label` attribute instead of `title`
5. Verify when you TAB (Keyboard) from the TAB title, the content gets focused, and you can tab into links, buttons.

## Steps to Test — Stories in general
- Check the Storybook sidebar is not sorted alphabetically
- New stories: Form/Input, Form/Radio, Form/Checkbox, Form/Textarea
- Dialog has a separate section now

issue.title: Fixes accordion trigger indicator animation
issue.body:
## Description

On the Dashboard, the CSS transform doesn't apply well resulting in the arrow not turning around. I've changed it so that it uses stronger selector specificity to avoid problems.

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test

I could only reproduce this on the Dashboard.

1. Pull down PR.
1. `npm run dev`.
1. Open Storybook.
1. Open the Accordion component
1. Verify that the chevron arrow rotates when opening and closing items.

comment.body:
@andrea-sdl I noticed the call to action buttons got misaligned in this PR:

** Before **

![Screenshot 2022-11-10 at 11 17 20](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/156388/201115312-95df2f08-57f0-41a5-8adb-ad0f45fbe3f0.png)

** After (in this PR) **

![Screenshot 2022-11-10 at 11 16 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/156388/201115129-922289a1-1ff0-4d73-bb48-982c38737314.png)

I suspect it may be due to a missing `flexGrow: 1` on the tab content.

pull_request.title: Revamp Radio Component with A11Y
pull_request.body: ## Description We are revamping the `Radio` component. Radio components only make sense to be used with two or more. That's the nature of Radios; you need two or more options. The current implementation lets you choose only one Radio button. In this new implementation, you must pass an array of options (similar to other components). This will provide more clarity and avoid forms with one radio button, and this new implementation is accessible. **BREAKING CHANGE**: The new implementation of the `` will break current usage. Once you upgrade this component, you need to change the implementation. Follow the Storybook story to understand the new API. ## Checklist - [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage - [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated ## Steps to Test 1. Pull down PR. 2. `npm run dev`. 3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/form-radio--default 4. Test the functionality. Make sure you can click/select using the mouse or keyboard the toggle and the label

pull_request.title: Improve Tabs, Textarea and Input components along with their Stories
pull_request.body:
## Description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3402/201184091-cf90be61-df40-4035-8331-737435aaedd6.png)


- Fixed the rendered `title` attribute as `aria-label` on the Tablist component
- Added a link and a button as the tabs example so we can ensure focusable elements gets focus when tabbing from the Tab title;
- Moved old form components like Input, Textarea, Label, Radio, and Checkbox to be used from the new `Form.Component` format. The old way still works.
- Added stories to Textarea, Checkbox, Radio
- Improved all Stories in general
- Moved Deprecated components to the end of the list of components
- Changed storybook configuration to list the stories alphabetically 
- Added `Validation` support to Input and Textarea

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [x] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test — Tabs

1. Pull down PR.
2. `npm run dev`.
3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/newtabs--default
4. Check the component renders with an `aria-label` attribute instead of `title`
5. Verify when you TAB (Keyboard) from the TAB title, the content gets focused, and you can tab into links, buttons.

## Steps to Test — Stories in general
- Check the Storybook sidebar is not sorted alphabetically
- New stories: Form/Input, Form/Radio, Form/Checkbox, Form/Textarea
- Dialog has a separate section now

issue.title: Fixes accordion trigger indicator animation
issue.body:
## Description

On the Dashboard, the CSS transform doesn't apply well resulting in the arrow not turning around. I've changed it so that it uses stronger selector specificity to avoid problems.

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test

I could only reproduce this on the Dashboard.

1. Pull down PR.
1. `npm run dev`.
1. Open Storybook.
1. Open the Accordion component
1. Verify that the chevron arrow rotates when opening and closing items.

pull_request.title: Revamp Radio Component with A11Y
pull_request.body: ## Description We are revamping the `Radio` component. Radio components only make sense to be used with two or more. That's the nature of Radios; you need two or more options. The current implementation lets you choose only one Radio button. In this new implementation, you must pass an array of options (similar to other components). This will provide more clarity and avoid forms with one radio button, and this new implementation is accessible. **BREAKING CHANGE**: The new implementation of the `` will break current usage. Once you upgrade this component, you need to change the implementation. Follow the Storybook story to understand the new API. ## Checklist - [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage - [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated ## Steps to Test 1. Pull down PR. 2. `npm run dev`. 3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/form-radio--default 4. Test the functionality. Make sure you can click/select using the mouse or keyboard the toggle and the label

comment.body: @djalmaaraujo I wonder if the overhead of `useMemo` is beneficial here. I would guess the options array will likely be small (< 5), and I don't see any heavy processing happening inside the loop.

pull_request.title: Revamp Radio Component with A11Y
pull_request.body: ## Description We are revamping the `Radio` component. Radio components only make sense to be used with two or more. That's the nature of Radios; you need two or more options. The current implementation lets you choose only one Radio button. In this new implementation, you must pass an array of options (similar to other components). This will provide more clarity and avoid forms with one radio button, and this new implementation is accessible. **BREAKING CHANGE**: The new implementation of the `` will break current usage. Once you upgrade this component, you need to change the implementation. Follow the Storybook story to understand the new API. ## Checklist - [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage - [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated ## Steps to Test 1. Pull down PR. 2. `npm run dev`. 3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/form-radio--default 4. Test the functionality. Make sure you can click/select using the mouse or keyboard the toggle and the label

pull_request.title: Improve Tabs, Textarea and Input components along with their Stories
pull_request.body:
## Description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3402/201184091-cf90be61-df40-4035-8331-737435aaedd6.png)


- Fixed the rendered `title` attribute as `aria-label` on the Tablist component
- Added a link and a button as the tabs example so we can ensure focusable elements gets focus when tabbing from the Tab title;
- Moved old form components like Input, Textarea, Label, Radio, and Checkbox to be used from the new `Form.Component` format. The old way still works.
- Added stories to Textarea, Checkbox, Radio
- Improved all Stories in general
- Moved Deprecated components to the end of the list of components
- Changed storybook configuration to list the stories alphabetically 
- Added `Validation` support to Input and Textarea

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [x] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test — Tabs

1. Pull down PR.
2. `npm run dev`.
3. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/newtabs--default
4. Check the component renders with an `aria-label` attribute instead of `title`
5. Verify when you TAB (Keyboard) from the TAB title, the content gets focused, and you can tab into links, buttons.

## Steps to Test — Stories in general
- Check the Storybook sidebar is not sorted alphabetically
- New stories: Form/Input, Form/Radio, Form/Checkbox, Form/Textarea
- Dialog has a separate section now

issue.title: Fixes accordion trigger indicator animation
issue.body:
## Description

On the Dashboard, the CSS transform doesn't apply well resulting in the arrow not turning around. I've changed it so that it uses stronger selector specificity to avoid problems.

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test

I could only reproduce this on the Dashboard.

1. Pull down PR.
1. `npm run dev`.
1. Open Storybook.
1. Open the Accordion component
1. Verify that the chevron arrow rotates when opening and closing items.

issue.title: Do not assume a header when a custom title node is given
issue.body:
## Description

Uses the provided header node instead of allowing customizing the variant via `titleVariant`.

## Checklist

- [ ] This PR has good automated test coverage
- [ ] The storybook for the component has been updated

## Steps to Test

1. Pull down PR.
1. `npm run dev`.
1. Open http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/wizard--custom-title
1. Verify that the given `title` prop of each step is not wrapped by a `h4`.
